comment: Lectures are clear & easy to take notes.She bolds key info in red and says it will be on the test. Get her to review your projects before due, shes very helpful if you reach out and show u care.I missed 1 HW assignment early in semester & reached out several times and she would NOT allow credit. I understand though, she states clearly in syllabus.

This is not a course you take for an easy A. There's multiple assignments due every week. You HAVE to study for the tests using her exam guides otherwise you will likely fail the tests. She seemed nice in the beginning of the course, but if you email her she is rude and condescending and may not even respond to your questions. I do not recommend.

This course is difficult. The tests are lockdown w/webcam and are hard because you have to know a lot of very specific information. There are discussions every week based off of module content. There's also textbook assignments due every week. She's not a bad professor- she's just difficult and unnecessarily rude. I was .6 points away from a B.

This is my second time taking Prof. Knapp; she is very nice, but this class did have a heavy workload. A discussion post every week that had multiple questions and a reply to one peer. Two major papers, but they were actually pretty interesting to write, four quizzes, and 2 tests (no webcam). The class is super easy if you put in the work.

Thinks her class is the most important thing in the entire world. There is so much busy work. Definitely watch all her lectures - which is anywhere from 1-3 hours a week, everything she says is in the exams. But the exams are very tricky true and false questions. Don't take for an easy A; you have to put actual effort in order to get a decent grade
This professor is simply amazing if you want to learn about nutrition, she is willing to help students by reviewing their work before it is submitted! She's extremely caring and very kind as well!

Prof. Knapp was pretty good. I will say the exams had a LOT of information on them and they are lockdown with webcam. Everything else in this class was fairly easy you just had to put in the effort. Sometimes she was a little harsh with the feedback but other than that she was good. For every test, she does review sessions and those seemed to help

Professor Knapp was a great professor for this class. It was a difficult class due to the amount of material you need to understand but overall, if you take time to study and understand the content it wasn't too bad. She was always available to asks question and is very knowledgeable on the content. Professor Knapp was always kind and cares a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Test heavy

comment: Overall, it is a pretty easy class as I am taking this for my minor in nutritional science: weekly discussion posts, weekly chapter assignments, and three case studies throughout the semester. Three exams, no cumulative final, not too bad. The teacher responds to emails quickly and gives good feedback on assignments if needed. Great Professor.

I have taken lifecycle nutrition and food & culture with Knapp. She is very sweet, replies to emails well.  There is a lot of content In these courses, sometimes a lot a week. Very few tests though. Food and culture had two essays that were rough.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Fairly easy class. Lectures every week and can be pretty long depending on the topic. 2 major projects, weekly homework, and occasional discussion posts. Not a very tough grader but very specific on what she wants. No extra credit opportunities, but late work is accepted.

Professor Knapp has one of the most organized and proactive online classes I've ever took. There is weekly discussion boards and homeworks, and two big projects but Prof Knapp assigns these as materials to succeed. Study guides every exam, major reivew prior, weekly announcements every week and rapid responses to emails. If you do the work, easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: out of all the online classes that I've taken here at KSU, this one has by far been the most work. There are multiple things to do per week. there are three huge projects due, and the exams are a lot of your grade. the overall workload of this class is ridiculous, especially considering that it is an online class. find another professor to take.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: the class I took with Professor Knapp has been the most organized and clear online course. This is not to say you won't have to put in work for your grades but all assignments are laid out in a checklist each week. It is so much easier to know exactly what is expected from you.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Knapp is really good about giving you good feedback to help you. She is also really understanding and is willing to restate information in a different way if you did not understand it the first time. This was my 4th consecutive semester taking her. She is so sweet and really passionate about what she teaches!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Do not get me wrong. Professor Knapp is an amazing professor and I have no doubt about it. She is tough on you only because she cares about you doing the best. I do recommend having her in class instead of online because everything is way harder with her online.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: Super chill, couple of test, only one is hard, and then there is a big assignment and mastering. Don't buy the book, but overall easy class with a good teacher. Clear and caring...

Her lectures are amazing. She's very thorough in her presentations! She is also engaging in the class. It is VERY hard for you to fail, unless you do absolutely nothing in that class. Just do your part, and she'll do hers. She's one of my favorite professors, and she's hot.

She is a really good professor. She knows what she's talking about and will explain something over if you don't understand. She teaches off powerpoints and has a study session before every exam. We have hw on Mastering Nutrition which is easy. Don't need to the book.

Easy Class! 16 homework assignments, 16 discussions, 4 extra credit opportunities, 3 test, and two projects! Everything is straight from the book. She provides great feedback on assignments and grades assignments right away. Do the homework and the discussions and you'll be fine. I got a B because I slacked off on the mastering homework.

I loved this class. Professor Knapp really knew the information. In order to make an a in the class you have to get at least a 92 so that kinda sucked. Definitely a harder class, but I enjoyed it and if you study you can make an a. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you should definitely go because she hints at what will be on the tests.

I took her for Principles of Nutrition. Interesting class, but she will make it feel upper level. She will pick out every single thing. Does not give any space to mess up just deducts points. You'll learn a lot, but its hard work. The test are tough because they cover 5 chapters of information and her reviews don't help much. Just read the book.

Online Nutrition class is tough as previous raters state.  Exams are all t/f and super tricky.  If you don't know the material you won't pass them.  Discussion posts require in depth posts and in depth responses.  You'll learn a lot but must work hard.   Professor is accessible via email or discussion posts.

I took three classes over the summer and this was my favorite because of how active the professor was. As opposed to my other professors, she gave very clear guidelines about was expected of students in their work and always gave helpful feedback. If I had a problem I could reach out to her and expect a speedy and useful reply.

Nutrition sounds easy, right? Except it is not. Be prepared to learn every detail about the digestive system. She does not take attendance, except for every once in awhile for extra credit. Go to class, though. You might not pass if you don't. You have to make a 92 in the class to get an A (a department thing). She is nice though, just be prepared.

I've taken Professor Knapp a few times, and she's very consistent. You know what she expects from you. Firm on her deadlines. Not many opportunities for extra Credit. You hardly need the book, but the answers to several question me are only given in lecture, so show up.  Laid back. Fair grader and very easy on the eyes, too

Prof Knapp is one of the best professors at KSU! The material can be tough, but she does a great job breaking it down in class. Come to class!!! She gives great study guides but you need to study those AND your notes from class to do really well on her the tests. Her lectures are fun and engaging! Can't wait to take another class from her!

Prof Knapp is one of my favorite professors ever at KSU. Her lectures are interesting and she does her best to answer any and all questions you have. Tests are long but if you read the book and review her power points you'll be fine! Has a few projects but if you're paying attention in class the projects and tests aren't hard.
Knowledgable, but she gives study guides for tests and then puts different information on the tests than is on the study guide. Very confusing strategy. This may be why most people fail her tests.

Professor Knapp is an amazing teacher. I  had her for both Food Science and Principals of Nutrition. Powerpoints are important, but she talks about additional information in class that will be on tests. Tests are very straightforward. The grade you get will depend on if you do the work and go to class. Amazing teacher.
I wouldn't take it. every test as 5 chapters of knowledge on it. Don't give good study guides.
Go to class. Take notes. Thats how you will pass the tests. Everything else is online homework. Not hard.

She is a great teacher! I took her for Principles of Nutrition. Posts power points online and tells you exactly what she wants you to know. She also does review sheets in class. Good at explaining and we also watch videos in class. Assignments are online on MasteringNutrition. Tests are online, but you do them in class in a computer lab.
